intro: Campanula oligosperma, commonly known as the lesser bellflower, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces bell-shaped blue to violet flowers in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky habitats. Campanula oligosperma is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
